column4: when i'm booting into ubutnu, 2 things failed to success. how can i see which one failed to load ?
to see the errors that happened during boot up
with dmesg, i cannot define what went wrong, bacause there's lots of stuff
is there any possibility to see the same stuff as it was happening when booting into ubuntu?
fine..but atleast you can go through the error messages and I guess that would help to figure out what exactly went wrong
did you look at those log files someone mentioned... /var/log/messages ?
if from these logs we can figure what went wrong with samba...
as i said it's hard to determine what wen't wrong, because if I search for daemon, i cannot find anything
then i dont have any idea how to figure that out...somehow we have to have that information..then only we can fix the problem
yes i agree, but how can i see in those /var/log/messages. how do i search for that error, that is the same as the error in booting process?
yeh you're right...sorry no idea on that ...
hm, so i'm stuck at this two errors :D, not a good day for ubuntu :)
or is there any posibillity to pause the booting process?
someone else will help you out .... :-)
i've never come across something like this....i mean the 'pause' thing...
